title: Taste Schema
description: A comprehensive, format-agnostic schema capturing the essence of a creator's voice across textual and visual dimensions

meta.voice_description: string: 1-2 sentence description of whose voice this captures

source_summary.text_sources: number: Count of text documents analyzed

confidence.overall: low|medium|high: Based on source quantity and variety
confidence.rationale: string: Brief explanation of confidence assessment

essence.core_dna: string: The single most important sentence capturing this voice's essence. What makes it instantly recognizable?
values: array: 3-7 core values that permeate all content
essence.worldview: string: How does this voice see the world? What lens do they apply?
essence.emotional_signature: string: The dominant emotional register (e.g., 'vulnerable optimism', 'playful authority', 'earned wisdom')
essence.transformation_promise: string: What transformation does this voice offer its audience?

dominant_arc_types.frequency: string: Percentage or ratio of usage
dominant_arc_types.signature_example: string: Brief example from source material
dominant_arc_types.structural_pattern: string: The beats this arc typically follows

number_patterns.preference: precise|rounded|sparse: How does this voice use numbers?
signature_numbers: array: Recurring numbers from their stories
number_patterns.comparison_style: string: How they frame ratios/comparisons (e.g., '27 hours vs their 3')

dominant_senses: array: Which senses appear most? visual, auditory, kinesthetic, etc.
physical_emotion_mapping: array: How emotions manifest physically (e.g., 'cheeks hurting from smiling')
environment_grounding: array: Types of environmental details used

domains: array: Where proper nouns come from (institutions, pop culture, places, etc.)
examples: array: Signature proper nouns from source material

thematic_clusters.count: number: How many stories in this cluster
thematic_clusters.voice_contribution: string: What voice elements does this cluster provide?

source_domains.function: string: What this domain is typically used to explain

explanatory_analogies.analogy_structure: string: How analogies are typically introduced (e.g., 'X is like Y', 'Imagine...', 'Think of it as...')

modes.function: string: What purpose this humor serves (disarms, builds trust, creates memory, softens)

humor_deployment.timing_patterns: string: Where humor typically appears (before credentials, after vulnerability, etc.)
off_limits: array: Topics/styles this voice never jokes about

contrarian_inversions.pattern: string: The structure used (e.g., 'Most people think X. I've found Y.')

vulnerability_layer.formula: string: The pattern vulnerability follows (e.g., 'specific + past + overcome')
shame_admissions: array: Types of shame this voice admits to
fear_admissions: array: Types of fears this voice admits to
failure_admissions: array: Types of failures this voice admits to
vulnerability_layer.vulnerability_boundaries: string: What this voice will NOT be vulnerable about

triumph_layer.earned_victory_pattern: string: How triumphs are paired with struggles
triumph_layer.improbability_framing: string: How unlikely success is quantified
present_day_proof: array: Types of current evidence used to validate past struggles

gratitude_layer.framing_pattern: string: The structure of gratitude (e.g., 'grateful to [person] for [action] because [impact]')

outsider_markers: array: What made/makes them an outsider
belonging_moments: array: Key moments of fitting in
bridge_identities: array: How they connect outsider past to insider present

always_present: array: Elements that appear in every piece
context_dependent: array: Elements that shift based on audience

naming_patterns: array: How frameworks are named (numbers, alliteration, metaphor, etc.)
framework_delivery.structure_preferences: string: How frameworks are organized (numbered lists, categories, sequential)

advice_inversions.pattern: string: Structure for flipping common advice

teaching_moves.pedagogical_style: string: How this voice teaches (Socratic, demonstrative, storytelling, etc.)

entry_points: array: Feelings/experiences used to create immediate recognition
universal_hooks.language_style: string: How hooks are phrased (internal monologue, second person, etc.)
universal_hooks.placement: string: Where hooks typically appear (opening, throughout, etc.)

vulnerability_gifts: array: What personal information is offered

implicit_permissions: array: What the audience is allowed to feel/do/be through this content
permission_grants.permission_pattern: string: How permissions are typically delivered

story_selection: array: Which stories for this audience
credibility_markers: array: What establishes authority for this group

transition_patterns: array: How stories connect to each other

color_system.palette_philosophy: string: The overall approach to color (bold, muted, high-contrast, etc.)

primary_colors.emotional_association: string: What feeling this color carries

forbidden_colors: array: Colors that don't fit this voice
color_system.color_relationships: string: How colors interact (complementary, analogous, etc.)

typography_system.philosophy: string: Overall approach to type (modern, classic, playful, etc.)
typography_system.hierarchy_patterns: string: How type sizes/weights create hierarchy

composition_system.layout_philosophy: string: Overall approach to arranging elements
preferred_structures: array: Common layout patterns (grid, asymmetric, centered, etc.)
composition_system.visual_flow: string: How the eye is guided through content

recurring_motifs: array: Visual elements that repeat across content
visual_metaphors: array: Abstract concepts and their visual representations

photography_style.if_used: string: Characteristics of photos (candid, staged, filtered, etc.)

mood_atmosphere.overall_mood: string: The dominant feeling (energetic, contemplative, bold, etc.)

examples: array: Specific textures used (paper, grain, gradients, etc.)

mood_atmosphere.lighting_tendencies: string: Bright, moody, natural, dramatic, etc.

emotional_range.emotional_transitions: string: How mood shifts within a piece

textual_anti_patterns.reason: string: Why it breaks the voice
textual_anti_patterns.example: string: What it looks like when done wrong

minimum_requirements: array: Hard requirements for any content in this voice

markers: array: The specific markers to check for

visual_priority: array: Which visual dimensions matter most
